io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent

Class AgentBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent.AgentBuilder

  • @NotThreadSafe
public class AgentBuilder
extends Object
    Builds Agent objects using the Builder pattern. 
     Agent agent = new AgentBuilder().setEnvironment(environment)
     .setExplorationStrategy(EXPLORATION_STRATEGY).setLearningRate(LEARNING_RATE)
     .setDiscountFactor(DISCOUNT_FACTOR).setQualityMap(qualityMap).getAgent();

    • Constructor Summary

      Start building an Agent that will interact with the given Environment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AgentBuilder

        public AgentBuilder(Environment environment)
        Start building an Agent that will interact with the given Environment. You can immediately call getAgent() to get an Agent populated with default values.
        Parameters:
        environment - the environment that the result agent will interact with.

    • Method Detail

      • getAgent

        public Agent getAgent()
        Get the resulting Agent that this object is building. Subsequent calls will return new and distinct agent objects.
        Returns:
        the Agent that this object was building.

      • getActionExecutor

        public Executor getActionExecutor()
        Get the Executor that this builder will give to its resulting Agent. This object could be a default value, or one provided by the user.
        Returns:
        the Executor that the resulting Agent will use.

        Returns:
        the DiscountFactor that the resulting Agent will use.

      • getEnvironment

        public Environment getEnvironment()
        Get the Environment that this builder will give to its resulting Agent. This object was provided by the user on construction.
        Returns:
        the Environment that the resulting Agent will use.

        Get the ExplorationStrategy that this builder will give to its resulting Agent. This object could be a default value, or one provided by the user.
        Returns:
        the ExplorationStrategy that the resulting Agent will use.

      • setDiscountFactor

        public AgentBuilder setDiscountFactor(DiscountFactor discountFactor)
        Set the DiscountFactor that this builder will give to its resulting Agent to control how it learns.
        Parameters:
        discountFactor - the DiscountFactor that the resulting Agent will use.
        Returns:
        this builder, for chaining

      • setExecutorService

        public AgentBuilder setExecutorService(ExecutorService executor)
        Set the ExecutorService that this builder will give to its resulting Agent to execute chosen Actions. By default, Agents are built with an ExecutorService that executes actions in the same thread, also known as a "direct" executor.

        If your Actions are fairly lightweight, any thread-based ExecutorService will incur too much overhead to be worthwhile. For example using a Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor() in the Gridworld example increases its execution time six-fold, purely through its overhead. Be sure that your Actions really do need to be executed in their own threads.

        Parameters:
        executor - the ExecutorService that the resulting Agent will use.
        Returns:
        this builder, for chaining

      • setExplorationStrategy

        public AgentBuilder setExplorationStrategy(ExplorationStrategy explorationStrategy)
        Set the ExplorationStrategy that this builder will give to its resulting Agent to control how it explores its Environment.
        Parameters:
        explorationStrategy - the ExplorationStrategy that the resulting Agent will use.
        Returns:
        this builder, for chaining

      • setLearningRate

        public AgentBuilder setLearningRate(LearningRate learningRate)
        Set the LearningRate that this builder will give to its resulting Agent to control how it learns.
        Parameters:
        learningRate - the LearningRate that the resulting Agent will use.
        Returns:
        this builder, for chaining

      • setQualityMap

        public AgentBuilder setQualityMap(QualityMap qualityMap)
        Set the QualityMap that this builder will give to its resulting Agent to store Quality values.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this builder, for chaining
